title: Mental Health Services & Supports for Students and Families
description:
This workshop by the Office of Prevention and Intervention will provide families with an understanding of the resources and services that are available to support student mental health needs. The information shared will include an overview of the available resources and services as well as the steps for students and families to access what they need. 

Recorded on November 13, 2024

title: Exploring After School Enrichment Programs
description:
Join this quick & engaging virtual workshop to learn:
- what out-of-school time activities are available throughout the city
- what makes a program a good fit
- how to use simple tools to explore options for your child

Recorded on September 18, 2024

title: The Power of Positive Parenting
description:
Children of all ages need a safe, secure, and loving environment to do well. Positive parenting reduces the stress of parenting and makes parenting more rewarding and enjoyable. The premise of Triple P is to do no harm to our children. For us, that means to do no harm physically, mentally, or spiritually -- which will be highlighted within the workshop. Our hope is to build a culture of Positive Parents.
Presented by Turning Points for Children

title: Redefining Math and Who It Belongs To
description:
What does it mean to be good at math or to be a “math person”? How we define mathematics and who it belongs to impacts the way our children see themselves in math. In this session, we will explore the values we should focus on in mathematics and how we can support children to see themselves as math people.

Presented by the Office of Curriculum & Instruction

Math Resources: 
- https://drive.google.com/file/d/1aXTwZ2OcGP6_sPDKBVq2-06zG5n03aWA/view
- https://www.mindsetkit.org/growth-mindset-parents/how-parents-can-instill-growth-mindset/activity-practicing-process-praise
- https://www.mindsetkit.org/growth-mindset-parents/learn-about-growth-mindset/reflect-on-your-beliefs

title: Parent's Guide to Cultivating a Love for Reading
description:
Many parents and educators have asked, “How do I cultivate a love of reading in an unmotivated reader?” This workshop takes an in-depth look at the correlation between reading and developing an extensive vocabulary, which is shown to determine intellectual ability and academic success in school. “The Four Keys to Cultivating a Love for Reading” are introduced: 1) Creating a Culture, 2) Reading Profile, 3) Engagement Appeal, and 4) Motivation. Finally, to cap off the workshop, a role-playing activity, followed by a parent-child accountability contract is introduced to ensure a solid commitment to cultivating a love of reading.
Presented by DBA Personal Safety & Educational Development

 How to Inspire Every Child To Be a Lifelong Reader, Alvin Irby - TED Talk: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ERSZb2wHFDw
